bill_title: enable persons completing certain state and local government forms to decline to specify the person's race on the form.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to enable persons completing certain state and local government forms to decline to specify the person's race on the form. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If any application form, reporting form, survey form, or other form that is required, produced, or used by any state agency or political subdivision of the state directs the person completing the form to indicate the person's race, the form shall include an option that enables the person to decline to specify any racial category. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
